EARLY CRICKET IN BOXGROVE The records of Chichester Cathedral show that on Sunday 28th April,1622, Anthony Ward(a servant of the Vicar of Boxgrove, Daniel Earle) and Edward Hartley played cricket in the church yard during Evensong. On the following Sunday 5th May another game was played with even more taking part. These were Edward Hartley,Raphe West,Richard Slaughter,William Martin,and Richard Martin Jnr. together with others whose names were not recorded. They were even helped by the two church wardens of the parish.Richard Martin Snr. and Thomas West. All were reported to the Bishop and had to go before him.(cont)
